intro: Verbascum sinuatum nothovar. crenatifolium, commonly known as the crenate mullein, is a hybrid plant characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is native to regions of southern Europe. The plant produces tall, hairy stalks that bear clusters of yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and have a soft, velvety texture, making it an ornamental plant in gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in Mediterranean climates.
